case_title: MAN MOHAN SINGH vs ASSISTANT COMMISSIONER OF INCOME-TAX
case_number: Civil Miscellaneous Writ Petition No, Nil of 1993
judgment_excerpt: Notices under section 148 have been issued against the petitioner. Thereafter, the petitioner made an application dated December 23, 1991, stating that the return filed under section 139 be treated to have been filed pursuant to notices issued under section 148. Following the decision in K.M. Bansal v. CIT (1992) 195 ITR 247 (All.), the assessing authority shall communicate the reasons recorded under section 148 to the petitioner within one week from the date a certified copy of this order is produced, subject to the necessity of protecting the source/informant. Proceedings relating to the assessment years 1988-89 and 1989-90 will not be completed until then.
relevant_statutes: Section 148 of the Income Tax Act, 1961
Section 139 of the Income Tax Act, 1961
order_instructions: The assessing authority shall communicate the reasons recorded under section 148 to the petitioner within one week from the date a certified copy of this order is produced along with the application. The petitioner may file a reply within one week of receiving the reasons.
